channel.title: What do YOU look for in a server?
channel.description:
What [i]do[/i] you look for in a server?
I look for a server that has a decent economy, high exp rate, decent player base (at least 10 daily), and fair staff.

item.title: What do YOU look for in a server?
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

I don’t like it when I can get everything easily, and if I can’t have a challenge on the server, I’ll quit.

Read full topic
item.source: What do YOU look for in a server?

item.title: What do YOU look for in a server?
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:14, topic:450687”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=553566.msg4056654#msg4056654 date=1343025509]

I look for a first-impression of how the forums look (whether I leave or not), I look to see if the administration is competent enough, and the staff members are fair, somewhat intelligent, active, unbiased, and following the rules.

I look what forum software they use.
How many members are registered, how many are online.
Log in to the server, look at the starter, the XP rate, the staff online, then the players.

Looking at the forum software? That’s an unfair bias. This is just an example, I don’t know what you prefer, but for example lets use this:
So your saying the if server A uses vBulliten, and server B uses phpBB, you think server A is automatically better than B just because of the forum software? I don’t think that’s very fair.

@OP: I take a look at the forums, see how active everything is, then when I proceed to the server, the first thing I like to see is someone at least welcoming me, this shows a small-server mentality, even in a big server. It’s also nice to not spawn for the first time at home, so its not so crowded.

Actually no, I like if they use MyBB or phpBB because vBulletin is usually a trashy dev team.
[/quote]
It could also mean that they are working very hard on the server, and do not have time to put the effort into a decent software for the forums. When I owned my server (long time ago), I never cared much for the forums as long as the server filled in for the forums in means of content and stability.[/quote]
Every server that thinks they’re big uses vBulletin and the community is retarded.

Another thing I look for, I don’t like coming on and seeing the staff cursing out other staff members.

Read full topic
item.source: What do YOU look for in a server?

item.title: What do YOU look for in a server?
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“ox random xi, post:8, topic:450687”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=553566.msg4056652#msg4056652 date=1343025386]

I look for a first-impression of how the forums look (whether I leave or not), I look to see if the administration is competent enough, and the staff members are fair, somewhat intelligent, active, unbiased, and following the rules.

I look what forum software they use.
How many members are registered, how many are online.
Log in to the server, look at the starter, the XP rate, the staff online, then the players.

Looking at the forum software? That’s an unfair bias. This is just an example, I don’t know what you prefer, but for example lets use this:
So your saying the if server A uses vBulliten, and server B uses phpBB, you think server A is automatically better than B just because of the forum software? I don’t think that’s very fair.

@OP: I take a look at the forums, see how active everything is, then when I proceed to the server, the first thing I like to see is someone at least welcoming me, this shows a small-server mentality, even in a big server. It’s also nice to not spawn for the first time at home, so its not so crowded.
[/quote]
Actually no, I like if they use MyBB or phpBB because vBulletin is usually a trashy dev team.[/quote]
It could also mean that they are working very hard on the server, and do not have time to put the effort into a decent software for the forums. When I owned my server (long time ago), I never cared much for the forums as long as the server filled in for the forums in means of content and stability.

Read full topic
item.source: What do YOU look for in a server?

item.title: What do YOU look for in a server?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

drubrkletern:

Non generic, meaning a server isnt good because it has X in its name, no matter how retarded it sounds DownyX, ObesityX, and its a generic pi loading 600+ graphics, just same shitty combat and all you do is pk with the same old shitty features, and has vbulletin for the forum, annoying tbh because thats the average pi…

True

Read full topic

item.title: What do YOU look for in a server?
item.dc:creator: @tim_the_kller tim the kller
item.description:
@tim_the_kller wrote:

i look for a good eco lots of things to do and many players and most skills working and you allways gotta have dat rune scimmy ;D

item.source: What do YOU look for in a server?

item.title: What do YOU look for in a server?
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

In a sense, I find it sort of fair in which software he uses, I don’t have some sort of loving desire to use IPBoard, I would rather use vBulletin and there has been times when I have left because a person uses IPBoard, I can’t stand the software whatsoever. Nonetheless, I do find that to be a bit harsh (I’m aware this is hypocritical), but I do see where he is coming from despise his lack of information on the subject.

Read full topic
item.source: What do YOU look for in a server?

Looking at the forum software? That’s an unfair bias. This is just an example, I don’t know what you prefer, but for example lets use this:
So your saying the if server A uses vBulliten, and server B uses phpBB, you think server A is automatically better than B just because of the forum software? I don’t think that’s very fair.

@OP: I take a look at the forums, see how active everything is, then when I proceed to the server, the first thing I like to see is someone at least welcoming me, this shows a small-server mentality, even in a big server.
